question: Awadh would not have been annexed with the British empire in the year 1856 if the Nawab of Awadh had
option2: not refused to introduce reforms as suggested by the British
explanation: Lord Dalhousie was keen on annexing the kingdom of Awadh. But the task presented certain difficulties because the Nawab of Awadh had been a British ally since the Battle of Buxar and had been most obedient to the British over the years. Lord Dalhousie hit upon the idea of alleviating the plight of the people of Awadh and accusing Nawab Wajid Ali on the ground of misgovernance and annexed his state in 1856.
